xxl.core.pipes.operators.groupers
Class PredicateGrouper<I>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,I>
          xxl.core.pipes.operators.identities.IdentityPipe<I>
              xxl.core.pipes.operators.groupers.AbstractGrouper<I>
                  xxl.core.pipes.operators.groupers.PredicateGrouper<I>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pipe<I,I>, Node, Sink<I>, Source<I>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class PredicateGrouper<I>
extends AbstractGrouper<I>

Operator component in a query graph that partitions the incoming elements to a number of groups. A user-defined unary predicate is applied to each incoming element. If its return value is true, a new group starts and the element is transferred to it, otherwise the element is transferred to the current group.
This kind of group-operation implies that only one group is subscribed at a moment to the group-operator, because the groups are filled sequentially.

Note: This group-operator performs only a partitioning, but no aggregation.

Example usage (1): 

        Enumerator e = new Enumerator(100, 100);
        final PredicateGrouper grouper = new PredicateGrouper(
                e, DEFAULT_ID, 
                new Predicate() {
                        protected int last = 0;
                        
                        public boolean invoke(Object o) {
                                int i = ((Integer)o).intValue();
                                if (i > last + 9) {
                                        last = i;
                                        return true;
                                }
                                return false;
                        }
                }, true, true
        );
        new VisualSink((Group)grouper.getReferenceToGroup(2), "Group 2", true);
        new VisualSink((Group)grouper.getReferenceToGroup(7), "Group 7", true);

Since:
1.1
See Also:
AbstractGrouper, Group, Predicate

Constructor Detail

PredicateGrouper

public PredicateGrouper(Predicate<I> predicate)

PredicateGrouper

public PredicateGrouper(Source<? extends I> source,
                        int sourceID,
                        Predicate<I> predicate)
Creates a new PredicateGrouper as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
ID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.
predicate - Unary predicate that determines, if an incoming element belongs to the current group or a new group has to be created.
Method Detail

transfer

public void transfer(I o)
Evaluates the group-predicate for the given element. If the predicate's return value is true, a new group starts and the element is transferred to it, otherwise the element is transferred to the current group.
The process method of this group is invoked with the element to be transferred.
If the output rate is measured, the output counter is incremented.

Specified by:
transfer in interface Source<I>
Specified by:
transfer in class AbstractGrouper<I>
Parameters:
o - The element to be transferred.

Returns a reference to the group that corresponds to the specified group-number groupNo.

Specified by:
getReferenceToGroup in class AbstractGrouper<I>
Parameters:
groupNo - The group-number.
Returns:
The group corresponding to the given group-number.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the group corresponding to this number has already been processed completely.
